name: James Gosling
background: Creator of Java programming language. Designed with 'write once, run anywhere' portability. Pioneered garbage collection in mainstream languages and bytecode virtual machines.

principles.name: Memory safety through managed runtime
principles.description: Garbage collection eliminates entire classes of bugs (memory leaks, use-after-free, double-free). Trade some performance for safety and developer productivity.
principles.falsification: In real-time systems where GC pauses are unacceptable, or in resource-constrained environments

principles.name: Simplicity over cleverness
principles.description: Java deliberately omits 'powerful' features (operator overloading, multiple inheritance) that cause confusion. Readable, obvious code beats clever code.
principles.falsification: When expressiveness genuinely improves code clarity, or when missing features force verbose workarounds

principles.name: Write once, run anywhere
principles.description: Platform independence reduces friction. Abstract away environment differences. The same code should work regardless of underlying hardware or OS.
principles.falsification: When platform-specific optimization is essential, or when abstraction layers add unacceptable overhead
